title: Biggest Gains in Financial Strength in the Management Top 250; Qualcomm, Prudential and Discover head the list
text:
Qualcomm's score for financial strength rose 20.3 points to 75.5, Prudential's score for the category climbed 18.4 points to 57.1, and Discover's financial-strength score gained 18.2 points to 60.3.

Among the Management Top 250 companies with the 10 biggest gains in financial-strength scores, Advanced Micro Devices Inc. has the highest score in the category, at 81.8—the fifth-highest score for financial strength among the Management Top 250.

EXPLORE THE MANAGEMENT TOP 250

* See how all the ranked companies perform across five areas.

* See the full Management Top 250 Report

General Motors Co. has the highest overall rank in this group, at No. 16. Two more also made the top 25 overall—Capital One Financial Corp. at No. 19 and Advanced Micro Devices at No. 25. Qualcomm ranks No. 51 overall.

Capital One, Prudential and GM also made the top 10 for increases in overall score. And Goldman Sachs Group Inc., with the eighth-biggest gain in scores for financial strength, also had one of the 10 biggest gains in scores for social responsibility.

You can explore the full, detailed rankings here, and see the companies with the biggest gains in scores for social responsibility here and for customer satisfaction here. In the coming weeks we'll take a look at the companies whose scores improved the most from the previous year in innovation and in employee engagement and development, as well as the companies with the highest scores for financial strength.

—Gerard Yates

Biggest Gains in Financial Strength in the Management Top 250
